resources.string: Always consult a Physician or a qualified health-care professional before beginning or modifying your exercise program.
Your target heart rate range is %d - %d

It is recommended that you exercise within 50 to 85 percent of your maximum heart rate for at least 20 to 30 minutes to get the best results from aerobic exercise. The Maximum Heart Rate (MHR) is the upper limit of what your cardiovascular system can handle during physical activity.

Note: Target Heart Rate is a range that\'s 50 - 80% of your Maximum Heart Rate. [These formulas varies and are estimates provided by American Heart Association (AHA). Maximum and Target Heart Rates may vary based on the health, fitness and gender of the individual.
How to Check Your Heart Rate

Right after you stop exercising, take your pulse: Placethe tips of your first two fingers lightly over one of the blood vessels on your neck, just to the left or right of your Adam\'s apple. Or try the pulse spot inside your wrist just below the base of your thumb.\\n Count your pulse for 10 seconds and multiply the number by 6.
Your heart rate training zone is a critical element in exercise. You must train at a variety of different heart rates in order to stimulate your body to improve your fitness level.
Improves basic endurance and fat burning
Improves overall health and helps recovery
This is to inform user that content of this app are not personal opinion. Rather they were gotten from sites like https://www.cancer.org and also from https://www.lifespanfitness.com
Zone 1 - Healthy Heart Zone: 50% - 60% of your Max Heart Rate
Body fat decreases, blood pressure lowered, cholesterol lowered, muscle mass improvements, decreased risk for degenerative diseases, safety high.
Zone 2 - Temperate Zone: 60% - 70% of your Max Heart Rate
Cruise Zone - you can train for extended periods of time in this zone, 75% - 85% of all calories from fat as fuel, 6 - 10 calories per minute

Gain muscle mass, lose fat mass, stregthen heart muscle, fat utilization zone, training your fat mobilization, fat transportation, your muscles burn fat, your fat cells to increase the rate of fat release, increase in the number of mitochondria in the muscle.
Zone 3 - Aerobic Zone: 70% - 80% of your Max Heart Rate
Transition Zone - from two health zones to two performance zones still feels comfortable, you will break a sweat, but no anaerobic burn sensation

Improved overall functional capacity with increase in the number and size of blood vessels, increased vital capacity, respiratory rate, max pulmonary ventilation, pulmonary diffusion, increase in size and strength of the heart, improvements in cardiac output and stroke volume.
Zone 4 - Threshold Zone: 80% - 90% of your Max Heart Rate

Max fat burn, but you must be fit enough to train with some oxygen present for additional fat burn. No fat burning if exercising above fat burning heart rate. High total calories, burned during exercise, high carbohydrates as source of calories. Improved VO 2 and higher lactate tolerance.
Zone 5 - Performance Redline Zone: 90% - 100% of your Max Heart Rate
Peak Race Zone - Athlete Only Zone!

Highest total calories burned, but lowest percentage of fat calories. Lactate tolerance zone. This zone is only for the very healthy and fit!!! Spending too much time in this zone, even for the elite athletes can be painful, cause injuries and lead to over training, which leads to poor performance!
